abstract: The American Medical Association asked the Justice Department on Monday to block the UnitedHealth Group‘s proposed $2.6 billion purchase of Sierra Health Services, saying the deal would be anticompetitive. The A.M.A. estimated that if the merger were completed, UnitedHealth would control 78 percent of the market for health maintenance organizations in Nevada and 95 percent of the market in the Las Vegas-Paradise area.
lead_paragraph: The American Medical Association asked the Justice Department on Monday to block the UnitedHealth Group‘s proposed $2.6 billion purchase of Sierra Health Services, saying the deal would be anticompetitive. The A.M.A. estimated that if the merger were completed, UnitedHealth would control 78 percent of the market for health maintenance organizations in Nevada and 95 percent of the market in the Las Vegas-Paradise area.

headline.main: A.M.A. Opposes UnitedHealth Deal for Sierra
